description: Maryland House sits on an 8.5 x 9m plot. Over 3 floors, the development holds a basement w/ 3.1m ceilings, 2 bd, 3 ba, studio space, and amenity on each level. Connected by a deep red staircase, light is spread via a glass blocks enclosure.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Sustainability was a critical component when designing and constructing Maryland House. The scheme used well-established processes to minimise the overall energy output and create a low long-term impact on the environment based on local cost parameters.

Main sustainable features include: 
	•	Prefabricated SIP Paneling as the Super Structure elements. glued and fixed with no air leakage.
	•	Basement construction using foam block system.
	•	Rainwater storage for the toilet flush
	•	Solar Panels with direct use through installed
	•	Battery System
	•	Roof and wall U-Values of 0.12-0.18
	•	Energy-efficient appliances

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The site of Maryland House had difficulty obtaining planning permission since 2002, but in 2016 Remi Connolly-Taylor and the Studio took on the challenge as a development scheme. When Remi returned from her period in New York City, she noticed the housing market didn’t reflect her needs as a young business owner. She wanted a space that allowed for ample natural light and room to work in a flexible studio. The proposal provides a bold bookend to the terraced street. By utilising London stocks related to surrounding dwellings, the Studio maintained the language and form of the area without compromising the quality of light to the adjacent structures.

The house combines work and living, addressing the current needs of a new generation of creatives based in East London. A spacious basement studio flooded with light from intricate and carefully considered design provides the ideal space for artists and creatives to work and live.

factsheet.heading: General Specifications
paragraphs: Basement Floor Contains: Dining Room, Living Room, Kitchen, Utility Room, Bathroom, and Garden.
Ground Floor Contains: Secured Entrance into the home, Double Bedroom with en suite, Single Bedroom with en suite, Garden
First Floor Contains: Studio Space, Terrace.

- Architectural Designer : REMI.C.T Studio 
- Structural Engineer Consultant : Albert Williamson-Taylor

name: Maryland House
